        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1411524: Security: Autofill UI does not protect against tapjacking
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1411524: Security: Autofill UI does not protect against tapjacking
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      stw.s...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/1920545668" title="stw.s...@gmail.com"><!---->stw.s...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      stw.s...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->stw.s...@gmail.com<!----></span>

        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The Autofill UI implements protections to filter out unwanted clicks. This is done either by applying a short cooldown period (requiring a pause between subsequent clicks), or requiring the mouse to move out and in the selected item. This makes clickjacking attacks considerably harder to execute.<span class="line"><!---->The Autofill UI implements protections to filter out unwanted clicks. This is done either by applying a short cooldown period (requiring a pause between subsequent clicks), or requiring the mouse to move out and in the selected item. This makes clickjacking attacks considerably harder to execute.<!----></span><br><br>However, as many devices support touch events, this opens up a surface for attacks. For example, the cooldown period seems to apply only for mouse clicks. This makes it possible to carry out a tapjacking attack on the Autofill popup.<span class="line"><!---->However, as many devices support touch events, this opens up a surface for attacks. For example, the cooldown period seems to apply only for mouse clicks. This makes it possible to carry out a tapjacking attack on the Autofill popup.<!----></span><br><br>SUGGESTED FIX<b class="line"><!---->SUGGESTED FIX<!----></b><br>Apply the cooldown period for touch events as well.<span class="line"><!---->Apply the cooldown period for touch events as well.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 112.0.5570.0 + all release channels<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 112.0.5570.0 + all release channels<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 11 with a touchscreen display<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 11 with a touchscreen display<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Open poc.html<span class="line"><!---->1. Open poc.html<!----></span><br>2. Tap twice on the screen<span class="line"><!---->2. Tap twice on the screen<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Thomas Orlita<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Thomas Orlita<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
          
      
        
          
          poc.html<b><!---->poc.html<!----></b>
          
        <div class="filename">
          
          <b><!---->poc.html<!----></b>
          
        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        </div>
      </dialog>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }

    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;

    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;

    align-items: flex-start;
  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>


      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {

          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1411524: Security: Autofill UI does not protect against tapjacking
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1411524: Security: Autofill UI does not protect against tapjacking
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      stw.s...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/1920545668" title="stw.s...@gmail.com"><!---->stw.s...@gmail.com<!----></a>

        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)

      <div class="select-container">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The Autofill UI implements protections to filter out unwanted clicks. This is done either by applying a short cooldown period (requiring a pause between subsequent clicks), or requiring the mouse to move out and in the selected item. This makes clickjacking attacks considerably harder to execute.<span class="line"><!---->The Autofill UI implements protections to filter out unwanted clicks. This is done either by applying a short cooldown period (requiring a pause between subsequent clicks), or requiring the mouse to move out and in the selected item. This makes clickjacking attacks considerably harder to execute.<!----></span><br><br>However, as many devices support touch events, this opens up a surface for attacks. For example, the cooldown period seems to apply only for mouse clicks. This makes it possible to carry out a tapjacking attack on the Autofill popup.<span class="line"><!---->However, as many devices support touch events, this opens up a surface for attacks. For example, the cooldown period seems to apply only for mouse clicks. This makes it possible to carry out a tapjacking attack on the Autofill popup.<!----></span><br><br>SUGGESTED FIX<b class="line"><!---->SUGGESTED FIX<!----></b><br>Apply the cooldown period for touch events as well.<span class="line"><!---->Apply the cooldown period for touch events as well.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 112.0.5570.0 + all release channels<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 112.0.5570.0 + all release channels<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 11 with a touchscreen display<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 11 with a touchscreen display<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Open poc.html<span class="line"><!---->1. Open poc.html<!----></span><br>2. Tap twice on the screen<span class="line"><!---->2. Tap twice on the screen<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Thomas Orlita<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Thomas Orlita<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Assigning Security_Severity-Medium because of the leak of user info in a place where it might subsequently be exfiltrated.<span class="line"><!---->Assigning Security_Severity-Medium because of the leak of user info in a place where it might subsequently be exfiltrated.<!----></span><br><br>battre@, hello!  I'm this week's security sheriff, and I hope you don't mind the drive-by bug assignment :)<span class="line"><!---->battre@, hello! Could you (or whoever on your team is most appropriate) look into this?  (In particular, it'd be helpful to know the earliest affected milestone so we can set FoundIn and Security_Impact accordingly.)<span class="line"><!---->But, assuming it works like in the video, this looks like a legitimate information leak vector, and the PoC seems easy to run provided someone has the right hardware.         <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1411524#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by

        For M112, this is already part of the code base.<span class="line"><!---->For M112, this is already part of the code base.<!----></span><br><br>For M111, I would argue that there's no point in merging the current fix on Canary, since that fix was part of a larger (~10 CLs) refactoring that touched thousands of lines of code. I could write a simple fix for the old code currently in M111, but that could not be tested on Canary beforehand. I am not sure that this bug is severe enough to warrant this. Dominic, any thoughts?<span class="line"><!---->For M111, I would argue that there's no point in merging the current fix on Canary, since that fix was part of a larger (~10 CLs) refactoring that touched thousands of lines of code.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }

        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      <div class="select-container">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The Autofill UI implements protections to filter out unwanted clicks. This is done either by applying a short cooldown period (requiring a pause between subsequent clicks), or requiring the mouse to move out and in the selected item. This makes clickjacking attacks considerably harder to execute.<span class="line"><!---->The Autofill UI implements protections to filter out unwanted clicks. This is done either by applying a short cooldown period (requiring a pause between subsequent clicks), or requiring the mouse to move out and in the selected item. This makes clickjacking attacks considerably harder to execute.<!----></span><br><br>However, as many devices support touch events, this opens up a surface for attacks. For example, the cooldown period seems to apply only for mouse clicks. This makes it possible to carry out a tapjacking attack on the Autofill popup.<span class="line"><!---->However, as many devices support touch events, this opens up a surface for attacks. For example, the cooldown period seems to apply only for mouse clicks. This makes it possible to carry out a tapjacking attack on the Autofill popup.<!----></span><br><br>SUGGESTED FIX<b class="line"><!---->SUGGESTED FIX<!----></b><br>Apply the cooldown period for touch events as well.<span class="line"><!---->Apply the cooldown period for touch events as well.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 112.0.5570.0 + all release channels<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 112.0.5570.0 + all release channels<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 11 with a touchscreen display<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 11 with a touchscreen display<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Open poc.html<span class="line"><!---->1. Open poc.html<!----></span><br>2. Tap twice on the screen<span class="line"><!---->2. Tap twice on the screen<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Thomas Orlita<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Thomas Orlita<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Assigning Security_Severity-Medium because of the leak of user info in a place where it might subsequently be exfiltrated.<span class="line"><!---->Assigning Security_Severity-Medium because of the leak of user info in a place where it might subsequently be exfiltrated.<!----></span><br><br>battre@, hello!  I'm this week's security sheriff, and I hope you don't mind the drive-by bug assignment :)<span class="line"><!---->battre@, hello! Could you (or whoever on your team is most appropriate) look into this?  (In particular, it'd be helpful to know the earliest affected milestone so we can set FoundIn and Security_Impact accordingly.)<span class="line"><!---->But, assuming it works like in the video, this looks like a legitimate information leak vector, and the PoC seems easy to run provided someone has the right hardware.         mr-edit-issue {

      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>

        <slot></slot>
      </label>

        }

          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>


      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>

      </button>

      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <small class="byline">

      link<a id="bugLink" class="material-icons" title="crbug link" href="https://crbug.com/1411524">link</a>
    <mr-crbug-link></mr-crbug-link>
          
        
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>

        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The Autofill UI implements protections to filter out unwanted clicks. This is done either by applying a short cooldown period (requiring a pause between subsequent clicks), or requiring the mouse to move out and in the selected item. This makes clickjacking attacks considerably harder to execute.<span class="line"><!---->The Autofill UI implements protections to filter out unwanted clicks. This is done either by applying a short cooldown period (requiring a pause between subsequent clicks), or requiring the mouse to move out and in the selected item. This makes clickjacking attacks considerably harder to execute.<!----></span><br><br>However, as many devices support touch events, this opens up a surface for attacks. For example, the cooldown period seems to apply only for mouse clicks. This makes it possible to carry out a tapjacking attack on the Autofill popup.<span class="line"><!---->However, as many devices support touch events, this opens up a surface for attacks. For example, the cooldown period seems to apply only for mouse clicks. This makes it possible to carry out a tapjacking attack on the Autofill popup.<!----></span><br><br>SUGGESTED FIX<b class="line"><!---->SUGGESTED FIX<!----></b><br>Apply the cooldown period for touch events as well.<span class="line"><!---->Apply the cooldown period for touch events as well.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 112.0.5570.0 + all release channels<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 112.0.5570.0 + all release channels<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 11 with a touchscreen display<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 11 with a touchscreen display<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Open poc.html<span class="line"><!---->1. Open poc.html<!----></span><br>2. Tap twice on the screen<span class="line"><!---->2. Tap twice on the screen<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Thomas Orlita<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Thomas Orlita<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        For M112, this is already part of the code base.<span class="line"><!---->For M112, this is already part of the code base.<!----></span><br><br>For M111, I would argue that there's no point in merging the current fix on Canary, since that fix was part of a larger (~10 CLs) refactoring that touched thousands of lines of code. I could write a simple fix for the old code currently in M111, but that could not be tested on Canary beforehand. I am not sure that this bug is severe enough to warrant this. Dominic, any thoughts?<span class="line"><!---->For M111, I would argue that there's no point in merging the current fix on Canary, since that fix was part of a larger (~10 CLs) refactoring that touched thousands of lines of code. I could write a simple fix for the old code currently in M111, but that could not be tested on Canary beforehand. I am not sure that this bug is severe enough to warrant this. Dominic, any thoughts?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1411524: Security: Autofill UI does not protect against tapjacking
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1411524: Security: Autofill UI does not protect against tapjacking
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      stw.s...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/1920545668" title="stw.s...@gmail.com"><!---->stw.s...@gmail.com<!----></a>

        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>

        </select>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The Autofill UI implements protections to filter out unwanted clicks. This is done either by applying a short cooldown period (requiring a pause between subsequent clicks), or requiring the mouse to move out and in the selected item. This makes clickjacking attacks considerably harder to execute.<span class="line"><!---->The Autofill UI implements protections to filter out unwanted clicks. This is done either by applying a short cooldown period (requiring a pause between subsequent clicks), or requiring the mouse to move out and in the selected item. This makes clickjacking attacks considerably harder to execute.<!----></span><br><br>However, as many devices support touch events, this opens up a surface for attacks. For example, the cooldown period seems to apply only for mouse clicks. This makes it possible to carry out a tapjacking attack on the Autofill popup.<span class="line"><!---->However, as many devices support touch events, this opens up a surface for attacks. For example, the cooldown period seems to apply only for mouse clicks. This makes it possible to carry out a tapjacking attack on the Autofill popup.<!----></span><br><br>SUGGESTED FIX<b class="line"><!---->SUGGESTED FIX<!----></b><br>Apply the cooldown period for touch events as well.<span class="line"><!---->Apply the cooldown period for touch events as well.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 112.0.5570.0 + all release channels<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 112.0.5570.0 + all release channels<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 11 with a touchscreen display<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 11 with a touchscreen display<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Open poc.html<span class="line"><!---->1. Open poc.html<!----></span><br>2. Tap twice on the screen<span class="line"><!---->2. Tap twice on the screen<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Thomas Orlita<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Thomas Orlita<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Assigning Security_Severity-Medium because of the leak of user info in a place where it might subsequently be exfiltrated.<span class="line"><!---->Assigning Security_Severity-Medium because of the leak of user info in a place where it might subsequently be exfiltrated.<!----></span><br><br>battre@, hello!  I'm this week's security sheriff, and I hope you don't mind the drive-by bug assignment :)<span class="line"><!---->battre@, hello!  I'm this week's security sheriff, and I hope you don't mind the drive-by bug assignment :)<!----></span><br><br>Unfortunately I don't have access to a physical Windows machine, so I wasn't able to reproduce this.<span class="line"><!---->Unfortunately I don't have access to a physical Windows machine, so I wasn't able to reproduce this.<!----></span><br><br>But, assuming it works like in the video, this looks like a legitimate information leak vector, and the PoC seems easy to run provided someone has the right hardware.  Could you (or whoever on your team is most appropriate) look into this?  (In particular, it'd be helpful to know the earliest affected milestone so we can set FoundIn and Security_Impact accordingly.)<span class="line"><!---->But, assuming it works like in the video, this looks like a legitimate information leak vector, and the PoC seems easy to run provided someone has the right hardware.           background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>

        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The Autofill UI implements protections to filter out unwanted clicks. This is done either by applying a short cooldown period (requiring a pause between subsequent clicks), or requiring the mouse to move out and in the selected item. This makes clickjacking attacks considerably harder to execute.<span class="line"><!---->The Autofill UI implements protections to filter out unwanted clicks. This is done either by applying a short cooldown period (requiring a pause between subsequent clicks), or requiring the mouse to move out and in the selected item. This makes clickjacking attacks considerably harder to execute.<!----></span><br><br>However, as many devices support touch events, this opens up a surface for attacks. For example, the cooldown period seems to apply only for mouse clicks. This makes it possible to carry out a tapjacking attack on the Autofill popup.<span class="line"><!---->However, as many devices support touch events, this opens up a surface for attacks. For example, the cooldown period seems to apply only for mouse clicks. This makes it possible to carry out a tapjacking attack on the Autofill popup.<!----></span><br><br>SUGGESTED FIX<b class="line"><!---->SUGGESTED FIX<!----></b><br>Apply the cooldown period for touch events as well.<span class="line"><!---->Apply the cooldown period for touch events as well.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 112.0.5570.0 + all release channels<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 112.0.5570.0 + all release channels<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 11 with a touchscreen display<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 11 with a touchscreen display<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Open poc.html<span class="line"><!---->1. Open poc.html<!----></span><br>2. Tap twice on the screen<span class="line"><!---->2. Tap twice on the screen<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Thomas Orlita<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Thomas Orlita<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
          
      
        
          
          poc.html<b><!---->poc.html<!----></b>
          
        <div class="filename">
          
          <b><!---->poc.html<!----></b>
          
        </div>

        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The Autofill UI implements protections to filter out unwanted clicks. This is done either by applying a short cooldown period (requiring a pause between subsequent clicks), or requiring the mouse to move out and in the selected item. This makes clickjacking attacks considerably harder to execute.<span class="line"><!---->The Autofill UI implements protections to filter out unwanted clicks. This is done either by applying a short cooldown period (requiring a pause between subsequent clicks), or requiring the mouse to move out and in the selected item. This makes clickjacking attacks considerably harder to execute.<!----></span><br><br>However, as many devices support touch events, this opens up a surface for attacks. For example, the cooldown period seems to apply only for mouse clicks. This makes it possible to carry out a tapjacking attack on the Autofill popup.<span class="line"><!---->However, as many devices support touch events, this opens up a surface for attacks. For example, the cooldown period seems to apply only for mouse clicks. This makes it possible to carry out a tapjacking attack on the Autofill popup.<!----></span><br><br>SUGGESTED FIX<b class="line"><!---->SUGGESTED FIX<!----></b><br>Apply the cooldown period for touch events as well.<span class="line"><!---->Apply the cooldown period for touch events as well.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 112.0.5570.0 + all release channels<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 112.0.5570.0 + all release channels<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 11 with a touchscreen display<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 11 with a touchscreen display<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Open poc.html<span class="line"><!---->1. Open poc.html<!----></span><br>2. Tap twice on the screen<span class="line"><!---->2. Tap twice on the screen<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Thomas Orlita<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Thomas Orlita<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 6<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1411524#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by stw.s...@gmail.com (Jan 30, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The Autofill UI implements protections to filter out unwanted clicks. This is done either by applying a short cooldown period (requiring a pause between subsequent clicks), or requiring the mouse to move out and in the selected item. This makes clickjacking attacks considerably harder to execute.<span class="line"><!---->The Autofill UI implements protections to filter out unwanted clicks. This is done either by applying a short cooldown period (requiring a pause between subsequent clicks), or requiring the mouse to move out and in the selected item. This makes clickjacking attacks considerably harder to execute.<!----></span><br><br>However, as many devices support touch events, this opens up a surface for attacks. For example, the cooldown period seems to apply only for mouse clicks. This makes it possible to carry out a tapjacking attack on the Autofill popup.<span class="line"><!---->However, as many devices support touch events, this opens up a surface for attacks. For example, the cooldown period seems to apply only for mouse clicks. This makes it possible to carry out a tapjacking attack on the Autofill popup.<!----></span><br><br>SUGGESTED FIX<b class="line"><!---->SUGGESTED FIX<!----></b><br>Apply the cooldown period for touch events as well.<span class="line"><!---->Apply the cooldown period for touch events as well.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 112.0.5570.0 + all release channels<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 112.0.5570.0 + all release channels<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 11 with a touchscreen display<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 11 with a touchscreen display<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Open poc.html<span class="line"><!---->1. Open poc.html<!----></span><br>2. Tap twice on the screen<span class="line"><!---->2. Tap twice on the screen<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Thomas Orlita<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Thomas Orlita<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
          
      
        
          
          poc.html<b><!---->poc.html<!----></b>
          
        <div class="filename">
          
          <b><!---->poc.html<!----></b>
          
        </div>

        Requesting merge to beta M111 because latest trunk commit (1106724) appears to be after beta branch point (1097615).<span class="line"><!---->Requesting merge to beta M111 because latest trunk commit (1106724) appears to be after beta branch point (1097615).<!----></span><br><br>Not requesting merge to dev (M112) because latest trunk commit (1106724) appears to be prior to dev branch point (1109224).       </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
